alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Carroll, southern Jackson, northern Cedar, northwestern Scott, northeastern Johnson, southeastern Jones and northern Clinton Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 717 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nashville to 6 miles north of West Branch. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Maquoketa and Nashville around 725 PM CDT. Delmar around 730 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Charlotte, Spragueville, Preston, Lowden, Miles, Andover, Wheatland, Sabula and Calamus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
